explains: n. 不法之徒，逃犯；<史>被剥夺法律权益和保护者
v. 使非法，禁止，取缔；（旧时）剥夺（某人的）法律权益

sentences.en: Jesse was an outlaw, a bandit, a criminal.
sentences.cn: 杰西曾是个逃犯、土匪、罪犯。

sentences.en: Art thou indeed that famous outlaw?
sentences.cn: 你真的是那个有名的绿林好汉吗？

sentences.en: It is therefore highly likely that the outlaw fishing boats harvested about 9,000 tons of lobster illegally that year.
sentences.cn: 因此，当年非法捕捞的渔船很可能非法捕捞了约9000吨龙虾。
